body:
### Problem

The following warning is emitted when calling `vim.lsp.codelens.run`:

> method textDocument/codeLens is not supported by any of the servers registered for the current buffer

Neovim 0.10 changed the behavior of `vim.lsp.codelens.refresh` to refresh all buffers by default in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27253. The warning is written when an LSP client that does not support code lenses is attached to a different buffer at the time the code lens executes.

The source appears to be a call to `vim.lsp.codelens.refresh` out of the [`execute_lens` handler](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/27fb62988e922c2739035f477f93cc052a4fee1e/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/codelens.lua#L53). Prior to 0.10, this would only refresh lenses for the current buffer but now it attempts to refresh lenses for all buffers.

### Steps to reproduce using "nvim -u minimal_init.lua"

1. Open a file and attach an LSP that does not support code lenses (e.g. dockerls)
2. Open a different file in another buffer and attach an LSP that does support code lenses
3. Execute a code lens in the second buffer
4. Observe that a warning is written

### Expected behavior

Running a code lens should not result in warnings associated with unrelated clients that are not attached to the current buffer.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0

### Language server name/version

gopls v0.15.3 and dockerls v0.12.0

### Operating system/version

macOS Sonoma and Ubuntu Linux 22.04

### Log file

https://gist.github.com/sykesm/55a67323b8af9bea59d61ee7d9a0d7fe
title: Unsupported method warning issued when calling `vim.lsp.codelens.run`
